Abigail Spencer: early life, education and family

Born and raised in Gulf Breeze, Santa Rosa County, Florida, Spencer was the daughter of Lydia Ann Brown and surfer Yancy Spencer III (1950-2011). She has two brothers, Yancy Spencer IV (born c. 1973) and Sterling Spencer (born c. 1986).

Caption : Spencer with her son ‘Roman Pruett’

Source : Twitter

Abigail Spencer: career and achievements

Spencer’s first major role was playing Rebecca ‘Becca’ Tyree on the ABC soap opera All My Children from June 3, 1999 to April 10, 2001. Similarly, she also starred in the Lifetime Television original series Angela’s Eyes. , which was canceled on December 1, 2006. In addition, in the following years, she began to play guest roles in several television series, including CSI: Crime Scene Investigation, How I Met Your Mother, Private Practice and Castle.

Additionally, Spencer joined the cast of the second season of HBO’s crime drama series True Detective in October 2014. In 2016, Spencer was cast in the NBC show Timeless as the lead character Lucy Preston, where she plays a history teacher sent on time-travel missions to different eras in an effort to prevent others from tampering with the web of U.S.-related schedules. A review of the series Variety says that Spencer is “prodigiously talented” and that she played “a character with important ‘intelligent’ and ‘courageous’ personality traits.” Meanwhile, a Deadline Hollywood review said the show was a waste of Spencer’s talent.

Subtitle : Actress on the sets of True Detective Season 2

Source : Elle

The New York Times wrote, “Abigail Spencer is every bit as likable as Lucy, the plucky historian who is the series’ central character.” NBC renewed Timeless on May 12, 2017. Also, the network initially postponed broadcast days. Ultimately, the decision was reversed. The show ended two seasons later.

Spencer has starred in several movies including In My Sleep (2010), Cowboys & Aliens (2011), This Means War (2012), Chasing Mavericks (2012), The Haunting in Connecticut 2: Ghosts of Georgia (2013), Oz the great and mighty (2013), and this is where I leave you (2014).

Abigail Spencer: personal life and husband

Spencer married Andrew Pruett in 2004 and filed for divorce in February 2012, divorcing in 2013. A short time later, in 2008, she gave birth to their son. However, Spencer was one of the guests at Meghan Markle’s wedding at St George’s Chapel, Windsor Castle, on May 19, 2018.
